Reviews.Title: “1 nights stay over in Rome - very nice”
Reviews.Author: littlelotty83
Reviews.Content: Booked through travel republic.com £40 for one night b&b. Located through large main door - on 2nd floor of building (press buzzer to be let in). Reception - small but nice reception area (but then it is only a small hotel). All staff very polite, friendly, lots of smiles made you feel very welcome. Rooms - average size, small bathroom but with everything you need, very nicely maintained and decorated. A little noisy at night, but then you are on a main road so this can't be helped - after a long day exploring Rome, it isn't too difficult to fall fast asleep! Breakfast - had to leave early for flight so didn't get to see breakfast, however, fresh croissants had just been delivered and the man at reception made sure to offer us some to take with us. Location - excellent - 3 mins from Colloseum/Forum/Palatine Hill e.t.c. - turn right out of hotel and come to crossroads in 30seconds - look left and the Colloseum is there - 3mins down the road and left and you come to the Colloseum. Overall, perfect affordable base for exploring Rome, rooms more than adequate for this purpose and staff very welcoming and friendly - would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location!!! Friendly and helpfull staff!!! Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandra W
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights there. everything was perfect! the room was very clean and quiet. breakfast good. helpful and always smiling man in the reception. location was the best, did not use public transport throughout our stay. 3 min walk to the Colosseo. if I come back to Rome, i definitely will stop in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I think it was absolutely fine!!”
Reviews.Author: Muzzyy23
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel because of the convenient price and location. Only afterwards I read the reviews and was a little concerned. When my brother and I entered the room, I immediately felt relieved! First: the hotel is in an "private" building,but this is common also for high rated boutique hotels in Vienna! The room (306 or 309-I don't remember) was perfect! The room had enough space, NO carpet (!!), the bed was comfortable, the window pointed the inside (so no noisy street), flat screen tv, safe, small bathroom but big shower, ... breakfast room is small and breakfast essential, but anyway fine with us! The staff was nice! Just a few steps away from Colosseum! I would go there again, but insisting to have the same room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try!”
Reviews.Author: Betilu
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews before travelling and booking this hotel, I was somewhat scared but took the decision of giving it a try. I was pleasantly surprised!!! What’s more, I stayed twice at Adas Hotel, in February and in July this year. It is a very cheap hotel so one must be aware of what to expect. I don’t agree with other reviewers. Some people seem to expect five-star facilities in a budget hotel. If one likes and enjoys comfort, big spaces, modern facilities, then one must choose another kind of hotels. This is a budget hotel, useful for having a bath and sleeping after a long day in Rome. It is just that! I paid 75 € for a triple room. That is very cheap! Breakfast included! It is true that breakfast is basic (some toast, bread, croissants, jam/butter, cornflakes, milk and the BEST coffee I have ever had in my life!!!). The hotel has rooms on different floors. The ones that are on the 6th floor are the best ones. Elevator goes to 5th floor only, so if you have heavy luggage, it is an issue. It is an old building (something usual in Europe), with old facilities but its location is perfect! Two blocks away from The Colliseum, about 8 from Termini station, right beside Trajan's Market and the Fori Imperiali, a short walk from Piazza Venezia as well as a short stroll to Santa Maria Maggiore and San Pietro in Vincoli, where Michel Angelo’s Moises is . It is true what some reviews claim that the hotel is not easy to find (its blue sign is very small) and the stairs “are very dark and unsigned so you are not really sure that you are in the right place”. This is so. However, the address (Via Cavour 233) is easily found, as Via Cavour (full of restaurants and souvenirs shops) is a busy road. Wi-Fi only in the very small reception area. Friendly staff. Free maps in the reception. If you are not picky about hotels, but just looking for a bathroom, a bed and a basic breakfast in the Eternal City, ignore all the bad reviews about this hotel!! I would definitely go back! In fact, I did!

Reviews.Title: “don t worry -great rate price quality”
Reviews.Author: corinav16
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a very nice staff and 2 kinds of rooms. on the 2 nd floor and 3 rd floor and on the sixth floor. we stayed at first on the 6 th floor. the room was very big and nice. it was a little noisy so we changed it with one on the 3 rd floor. it wasn t on the back side of building but it had 2 sided windows so no noise. the staff changed our room they were very nice. the towels were changed daily, and very clean. i don t undestand the complainers at all. it s a great hotel for a minimum decent stay and great price. indeed the building is very old but that s why rome is great . the breakfast is typical for italiens but for a start of sightseeing is was sufficient. the position is very very good

Reviews.Title: “Try to find another one”
Reviews.Author: PatiSantos
Reviews.Content: The only positive aspect of this hotel is that it is really close to subway, Colosseo and Foro Romano. And this is it. Try not to miss it when coming down the Via Cavour. It's a tiny door and the main desk is not at the ground level. The elevator is too old and doens't get you through the higher stores. If you're carrying a lot of baggages, big issue. Bad breakfast and coffee didn't taste good. But this is typical Italy. As a brazilian myself, used to drink great coffee, was a bit disappointed. Staff not kind. The owner is very greedy or at least that was the impression that we got. Upon our arrival we had already paid 50% and the other 50% would be paid at check out. One day, not our last day there, this guy out of the blue demanded our payment. Kindly I answered that this wasn't what we had agreed and just left. The bathroom had a leak problem and shower wasn't as easy/comfortable as expected. And finally, my family called and left a message at the main desk as I was having some issues with my cell phone. I receive the message 36 hours later, after being to the main desk at least twice. If you're going to spend ALL DAY walking around Rome and returning to the hotel ONLY to sleep this could be an alternative, as it has easy access to subway and some historical points, but be aware of some headache you may get along your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Peanut2209
Reviews.Content: Building: Creepy elevator, size XS, have to use stairs, because elevator goes to 5th floor, and my room mas at 6th. Room: Changed room because the drain was full of ashtray in the shower, dirty water overflow. But the same pattern of cleanliness on the other room: fungus on bathroom ceilling; used botle and insect fezes on the refrigerator; dust in the curtains, blanket, floor, wardrobe, everywhere; the terrace was an ashtray, full of cigarettes. this is the chamber of death for someone with allergies. Breakfast: Terrible and unfriendly service, tiny room with poor quality and variety of food. I was served a half eaten croissant, and 3 minutes before brakfast end time, the coffe machine was turned off. Staff: Unfriendly and unhelpfull My wife asked for a divorce when she entered the hotel room I choosed because I wanted to save some money, but the RoI was even worse as I had to compensate buying expensive purses to compensate. Besides all that, the location is great, near the colosseum and metro station. If you are alone or with a group of male friends and staying near the colosseum is a must, stay in this hotel, otherwise book some hotel more distant and spend 15-20 minutes per day.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: westaussiesontour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little dodgy and we initially felt unsafe. The hotel is not easy to find and the stairwell is very dark and unsigned so you are not really sure that you are in the right place. The safes do not work so you can not lock up your passports and valuables! Then you also have to give the staff your room key when you go out for the day. The room was dirty and it is difficult to sleep as the traffic is very noisy. Breakfast consists of a bowl of cereal and a bread roll. The only good thing is that it is very close to the Colasseum and close enough to Termini station. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If looking for location - this is the hotel, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: doritam1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny and dirty. Quality of breakfast is poor. The hotel is located in an apartment building with a tiny elevator, shich I guess is typical in Europe. After arriving late at night and receiveing a tiny tiny room we found that the drainage in the shower didn't work, a/c was unavailable and the room was filthy. Took a while for the night clerck to give us a different room. It was a centimeter larger but still with same problems. No phone that works either. When asked about wifi he said that it only works on the second floor. We found out the next morning by the young girl at the desk that there is wifi - and there is no problem. She was very sweet and accomodating. All in all - the location is wonderful but I doubt that I will ever return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheery for the price”
Reviews.Author: dubsthcentralboy
Reviews.Content: This is a very good-value hotel. One of the best features is the location, right beside Trajan's Market and the Fori Imperiali and a shoth walk from the Colesseo and Piazza Venezia while also a short stroll to Santa Maria Maggiore, San GIovanni and Termini. The hotel is very basic and sub-divided around a palazzo. The romms are small and basic but about right for the price and an ideal base for people o are going to be out all day and do not expect the absolute lap of luxury upon return. I didn't eat breakfast in the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Adas is a very bad Hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: HouseSparrow
Reviews.Content: Extremely high traffic noise from Via Cavour. Safety box, WiFi, TV, … did not work. Mold in the frigde. Bad and delayed breakfast; cold coffee, old bread with jam or nut cream, bitter and extremely sweet orange drink. Some people in the staff were trying, but the management seems to have very low ambitions.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking for another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bull1815
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. It is just minutes to the Colosseum. However, it has the worst beds I have ever slept on. I think it was just a boxspring and no mattress. I could feel the springs through the bed. The rooms were on the smaller side but sufficient for what we needed. Positives: Great location, good price, hot water never ran out, Cons: Bed, wi-fi only worked on 2nd and 3rd floors (we were on the 6th), breakfast (it might be free, but I would rather pay for something more than a roll and juice)

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: JonesWarrington
Reviews.Content: Great location but the hotel was awful. I never complain but this was poor. First room had no curtains just a net across which kept us awake all night and the shower didn't work so we couldn't shower. Moved rooms the next day and the room was better but we had a few bug friends with us. A school party was staying on the 6th floor with us and they had a party all the next night. Walls are very thin so you hear everything. Fridge in the second room but it was full of mould and stank. Hairdryer was coming off the wall and the toilet seat fell off. It was still better than the first room!! Beds were hard and the breakfast was not good. I never expect much but even the coffee was cold out of the machine. Just bread rolls and jam or chocolate spread. Hotel staff were ok but I got the feeling they were used to the constant stream of complains. Would mind any of the above due to the location but if you can't sleep it spoils the trip.

Reviews.Title: “best choise in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mihaelaradu9
Reviews.Content: It is the best hotel in Rome for a budget hotel.It is very well situated ,near Colloseum and very close to San Pietro in Vincoli Church where the statue of Moise by Michelangelo is exposed.The stuff is very friendly and helpful,the breakfest is at your choise whith plenty of milk,coffe,jam,butter,etc.. They have hot water,the temperature in the room was very good,very clean rooms ,they make clean every day.We had a great time at this hotel during the nights ,because all day long we were outside walking,the hotel being situated nearly to the major points of interest in Rome:Piazza Venezia,Fontana di Trevi,Altare della Patria,Foro Romano,etc you will see. We have been there with our daughter 6 year older,and we just walk to these objectives and many others. So,if you want to visit Rome and not to stay all day in the hotel ,hotel Adas is your best choise. P.S. We had booked a triple room so the size of the room anh the bathroom was properly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FromValbyWithLove
Reviews.Content: Okay standard and good value for money. Very small room, but clean and okay breakfast (though the coffee from the machine could be better). Near the Metro and a nice quarter in the back with cafées and nice restaurants (can recommend a local restaurant with traditional Roman food just beside Cavour metro). Walking distance to all major attractions. Very close to Colosseum. Only minus is that they say they have wireless network - but it didn't work (and might never have!). Some wrote negatively about city tax - 2 euro per night. Rubbish as complaint. It is standard everywhere, and they write about it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel in a great location with an ok price.”
Reviews.Author: tagell87
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated just 5 minutes walk from the old Roman ruins and 15 from the centre where the likes of the trevi and pantheon are located. Our transfer mini-bus driver initially couldnt find it and had never dropped people here before, however we soon made it. Check in is on the 3rd floor and our room on the 6th, which is also where breakfast is served. Ther are 120ish stairs or the lift, which looks like it was left by ceasar himself. Not for the fainthearted. There is a member of staff at the desk 24/7 which is good, however we were told not to take our room key out with us, to leave it at the desk when heading out, and pick it up when returning, and buzz to get into the block the hotels is in everytime. Thus meaning anybody could then turn up at the desk, state the room number and then are given the room key as different people were always on the desk. There was also a tax of 2 euro per night per person that the government has introduced which we were not aware of. The rooms are tiny, a bit on the chilly side at night as the radiator was tiny and the bed completely rock solid, even for a 23 year old. The smell from the shower was disgusting, and breakfast pretty basic.

Reviews.Title: “The room was extremely clean. We were in...”
Reviews.Author: Techie214
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely clean. We were in room 605 on the 6th floor. The elevator and reception starts on 2nd flr and stops on the 5th flr. Breakfast includes coffee, croissant, cereal, milk and juices. 7-10am. It's very close to the Cavour Metro stop. A slightly longer walk to the Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Should be three stars”
Reviews.Author: Canuk665
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the staff... we dealt with no less than 3 people at the front desk, and everyone was excellent. The layout of the hotel throws you off a little bit at first, but don't worry, you'll find it quaint after the initial confusion. The room we had was excellent. I've never been as pleasantly surprised. The bathroom was great, the bed was clean, lots of storage space and a tv. breakfast was nice, with orange juice, coffee, buns with jam plus some prepackaged snacks on the tables. There's also cereal/milk if you prefer. If you go to the window of the lunch room ( 6th floor) you can see the top of the Colosseum. Watch the stairs... they are spiral and slippery due to years of use( my arm still has the mark of where I fell when i wasn't paying attention, clearly my fault ). note that there is a small elevator that seemed to work well while we were there. we just preferred the stairs. As for location, we were very pleased. you are a few minutes from the Colosseum, and all the other major sites. And if you want to venture farther, metro is close and the train station is just up the street. Stuff nearby: If you want a good cheap meal try the kebab place down the street... good pizza and good kebabs. There's an internet place on the first cross street (on the right) that has phone booths as well. good rates and close to the hotel. you'll probably pass it lots of times as you trek down to the sights. Only negative was the street noise, but the rooms facing the street do have double windows and shutters and you can close them and use the AC instead. if you find the street noise disturbing, you may want to try a room facing the back alley. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ADAS it`s O.K. !”
Reviews.Author: JOB35
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated very close to Colosseum (3 minutes walking). The rooms are not so large but are clean. I think that Hotel Adas it`s O.K. for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “it is ok for 2 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: mara197014
Reviews.Content: I was here with my husband for 3 night.Hotel is clean,staff is very frendly(a big hello and thanks for Doru from reception and for him collegue ),breakfast was ok for the money payed(yogurt,milk,cereals,coffee,croissants,gems),location is very good (max 300 m to Colosseum and 50-100 m to metro station Cavour and San Pietro in Vincoli).Our room was small but enought for us,the view of our window was a little strange but ....dont matter (we stayed in room only 7-8 hours per day for sleep in night and shower) so if you have a cultural travel and you want a hotel only for sleep and shower i recomand it ,is a budget hotel with a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Ipod stolen - hotel staff couldn't care less”
Reviews.Author: Nassenoeff
Reviews.Content: They did have clean rooms, but a very small and uncomfortable bed. The room in general was very small, no air condition and the fridge did not work. The breakfast is not even worth ment0ioning. Worst of all my iPod Toch got stolen from the room, and the hotel staff couldn't care less. I had to spend valuable holiday hours in Rome at the local police station. They did offer cheap transport to the airport by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, cheap and a good choice”
Reviews.Author: MacaronniMastroiani
Reviews.Content: Hotel ADAS is located just a few blocks from the colosseo and the roman forum. The hotel is the via cavour, which is full of restaurants, and souvenirs shops. The rooms are pretty, pretty, pretty good and the staff very nice. The breakfast is good to, no complaints...The only negative thing I noticed about this place is the strange smell that the lobby has...It's exacly the smell of B.O. (Body odor)...

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: traveltobrussels
Reviews.Content: This is the first time for me to give less than 3 points to hotels. I regret I made a wrong choice. Probably the hotel did not make any fatal error, but lots of small things which should be mentioned here. This evaluation may be based on my personal preference. Actually many other guests have given good ratings. Therefore, to avoid emotional discussion, I will try to describe as factual as possible. 1. Hotel management Adas Hotel, Romano Inn, Centro Romano -- peculiarly, these hotels are the same hotel. Same reception, same breakfast room, except that under which name you book through. Compare their websites. This means that, when you make a booking of either of those hotels, you should also refer to reviews for other two hotels. Adas Hotel -- 1200th, Centro Romano -- 120th. The appropriate ranking may be somewhere around 700th. 2. Room About 9 square meters. (2.25m*4m), 3 sm (1.5m*2m) of which was a en-suite facility with shower cubicle (80cm*80cm), washing basin and toilet. Smaller than the room shown on their website. Seems recently refurbished, cleaned well, whereas a 10cm hole could be seen on the wall, dust falling down. Room on the north side of the building, with 1m*80cm window. Loo cracked. May hurt your bottom. No heating facilities. Only an air conditioner. Of course, no fridge, tea facilities. 3. Towel Interesting. Perhaps it was not 100% cotton, but paper-mixed textile. Like disposable table clothes. No exchange during our stay for couple of nights. 4. Breakfast 7:30-9:30, not by 10:00. Menu was as advertised (coffee, croissant, cereal). The breakfast room was tiny. 18 people within about 10 sm (=2people in 1sm), and no confort. I had to que up to get a cup of coffee. Imagine fully-seated Mcdonalds. The personal space might be even smaller than Mcdonalds. I got pretty tired from the morning, though I had a lot to do on the day. You may have to wait to get a seat in busy time. We gave up having breakfast there from the second morning. 5. Payment Cash only. Credit card not accepted, on the contrary to the advertisement. 6. Check-out 10:30, not 11:00 (advertised time) 7. Location&no robbery Location is relatively good, close to the metro station. Our luggage was not robbed, though we left it (locked suitcase) in our room. We paid less than 100 euro per night, which was cheaper than the standard price in central Rome. It is all up to readers if this hotel is worth staying. I may stay there if I am a single traveler and the price is below 39 euro per night...

Reviews.Title: “its ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Ellis40
Reviews.Content: Rome is not a cheap city to stop in and so its difficult to find a bargain hotel. I guess for Rome the Ada is cheap, but compared to elsewhere its not. The room we stopped it was a bit tatty, clean but dated. The wall paper was a very dirgy coloor and the wall had one or two stains on it. The bed covers had holes in them! However saying that I o back to the point that it was clean. The hotel is very safe and is very close to the colleseum. It is a long walk from Termini Station so be warned. Saying that it is downhill! The breakfast is nothing to write home about, some soft cornflakes and a croissant, the orange juice is more watery than juicy. Overall i would say that if price is a consideration stop here but don't expect a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpressable. False pretences.”
Reviews.Author: adas16
Reviews.Content: When we entered the room, we almost toppled backwards from a horrible mould smell. Huge stain at the ceiling from water spotting. (painting the walls in the same colour was a tricky idea but couldn´t deceive THAT smell. My boyfriend has asthma and got problems with breathing that night). The bedsheet had yellow stains on it. Cold airdraught from a untight window, curtains just adornment, couldn´t be closed. Shower armatures: totally damaged. No room even to place the sponge bag in the bathroom. An inexpressable brashness to sell such a room for a price of 75 EUR per night.

Reviews.Title: “Adas Is Fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal79079
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Adas over the Christmas holidays. I have to say that it is really a great deal! The location is amazing just around the corner from the colosseum (which of course was our first stop as tourists) The rooms are really comfortable and clean. While we were there the hotel staff gave us loads of suggestions and really helped us figure our way around until we felt like locals! We recommend this hotel to any one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but not beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Jamie08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Adas for 4 nigths in December. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel is location is very good. The staff actually gave us very good hint about reastaurants etc. We had our room in second floor so there was not any problems with the elevator and it was easy to leave the key to the reception desk. The room was guiet , but I have to admit that it was a litlle bit "worn out"... It would need al litlle make-over. The bathroom was ok though: clean and big enough. Some people complain that all the tv-channles were Italian, but that's just fine because we were in Italy! When in Italy i enjoy to follow Italian tv channles, not CNN. Still we would like to complain about one thing. The room was very cold and the centlar heating didnt work proberly. This was a promlem because the nights we stayed in Rome were probably the coldest of the year.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: silvy1957
Reviews.Content: I enjoy a lot this hotel. Very nice and quiet, wherw i rest my self in the best way having an unfogettable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: irazor
Reviews.Content: After reading all (mainly negative) reviews on tripadviser about Hotel Adas in Rome, we had very low expectations. We even wanted to book another hotel. But we were glad we did not. Although not everything was perfect we were still happy with our choice. So on to our review: The room was very clean and big enough. There's a safe (costs extra), a mini bar, Television (only italian channels, but there was also a digital receiver but we hat no idea how to use it or if it costs extra too) and air conditioning (5 euros per day). The bathroom (with shower) was also very clean but too small. You are not able to dress yourself there. The breakfast was ok. You can choose between coffee, cappuchino, latte and tea (we have no idea if you can get more than one cup). A pitcher of orange juice was also put on the table. The buns were very small , but you can also have cornflakes, biscuits, croissants, and something like croissants with chocolate in it. Additionally there's butter, cheese, ham and marmelade. The staff was very friendly, but unfortunately the hotel owner doesn't speak any english. But there are two big problems remaining. The first one is: The Hotel is situated at a busy road, so the night might not be as calm as you want to (being in a room on the road side). And the secound one is: if you have a room on the 6th floor and want to leave the hotel, you have to go downstairs to the 5th floor, then with the elevator to the 2nd floor (leave key at the receiption) and then again with the elevator to the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than told before”
Reviews.Author: Scandinavian1
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from Rome and stayed 5 nights at the Adashotel. I was scared to go there because of the previous reviews, but the hotel was ok. You can't expect much if the hotel costs less than 500 usd/5 nights/double room. The lady in the reseption was very friendly. We had a nice room on the 2nd floor. It was a bit noisy at nights but not too bad. It was clean ja everything worked ok. The room looked just like the pictures at the adashotel website ([--]). Breakfast was good, only the thing that you only get one cup of coffee, bothered me. If I had believed everything that was told about the hotel before, I would't have pickd that one. You get a good view of the hotel by looking the website of the hotel. I don't know if the owners have something against americans because many of you have told bad things about the hotel. We are from Scandinavia and they were friendly. The location is excellent, rooms are good, price is cheap. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Hotel Adas”
Reviews.Author: PalParkGirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Adas was not a very pleasant one. When we arrived for check in, we discovered that we would have to pay an additional 5 Euros per day to rent the air conditioning! I've stayed at a lot of hotels and I've never had to rent air conditioning in my life. We then discovered that our room was on the 6th floor (as are most of the rooms) and our elevator onlly went up to the 5th floor. We had to lug several heavy bags up an extra flight of stairs. The elevator was small and could not accommodate our bags and us so we had to go in shifts. When we did arrive at our room it was small and clean with a new bathroom. However, the "double bed" was actually two single beds pushed together. Anytime my husband or I would go towards the center of the bed, the beds would come apart. I asked for a room with a true double bed and was told the hotel does this for all their rooms so that every room can accommodate separate travelers as well as couples. The towels in the bathroom are comparable to very large dish towels. The hotel also requires that you leave your room key at the front desk every single time you leave. This is a nuisance as you have to stop on the second floor every time you leave and stop there again every time you come in. It felt a bit like we were being babysat. On our last day, we asked for a taxi to come pick us up at 3:45 AM as we had a 6:30 AM flight. By 3:55, we were getting concerned as the airport was 30 minutes away and we wanted to be there 2 hours prior to the departure. When I went back upstairs to ask the night desk attendent to call the taxi company the holel had recommended, he acted very nonchalantly and told me that I should just wait 10 more minutes even though the taxi was already running almost 15 minutes late at that point. We ended up having to flag down another taxi that was driving by. Note, the hotel had quoted us 49 Euros for their taxi service and the street taxi cost only 40 Euros. The hotel is near the Colliseum so the location is a good one, but there are dozens of hotels in that area so I would suggest you keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as described previously”
Reviews.Author: kcsipke
Reviews.Content: I was scared enough to go to Hotel Adas having read the prevoius posts - but had no other choice (the other hotel cancelled our reservation 2 weeks before the trip, and couldn't find anything else). The hotel is 'you get what you paid for', but it was all right. The rooms are nothing special - they are on the 2nd and 6th floor of the buliding. Our was on the 6th (elevator till te 5th). We checked in at 14.00 CET, and checked out 5 days later at 10.00 CET. The room was all right - with TV, small bathroom (clean towels every day, hairdryer in). Breakfast is usual continental - jam, nutella, butter, coffee or tea). Great location - 3 minutes from Colosseum and Forum.

Reviews.Title: “low standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: mowitt
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good. The standard of the room is very bad. Our room was smelling very bad from the drain. Some of the staff were helpful, but don't expect much. The breakfast is of low standard, but remember that you are in Italy. I will give the hotel 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “sounds awful glad they lost our booking!”
Reviews.Author: foxynats
Reviews.Content: we got there at midnight only to be told we had no booking and no rooms to fit us in! This was even though we had a print-off stating we had booked. The guy said the same to the couple infront of us too and they managed to get a room! weird eh? and what made it worse was that he was more interested in looking at ebay! However, he did manage (aventually and not happily!) find us a room at the Italian B&B which was gorgeous - so after the drama i think we got a better deal!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: south shields tyne and wear u.k
Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in budget class ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When viewing the hotel on its website, the rooms look lovely. Not so in our case (room 14 is the pits!!!). The white net curtains were grey, the main curtains wouldn't pull closed and the dirt on the overhead fan (which didn't work) was disgusting. And if you want a hot shower after 9 a.m in the morning, forget it, a cold wake you up one after a horrendous night sleep on a camp style bed is the best you can expect! The continental breakfast is also a joke. A cup of tea or coffee, a glass of orange juice and breadbuns and jam is the standard menu. No selection of cheeses and meats here! My advice to anyone thinking of booking this hotel , is to look somewhere else - anywhere else can only be better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcoming and rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room had a horrible view of toliet paper piled in front of our window and we didn't even have the option for air conditioning in our room. The people there were very unfriendly and did not care if we enjoyed our stay or not. I even told a girl who was about to check for rooms there to go find another place because this hotel stinks!!! Unfortunately, it truely made our trip to Rome a bad experience. If we were to go again we would stay far away from Hotel Adas!!
